question: Where do the main characters live?
story:
Hawthorne rolled over in bed and looked around the room.  He let out a breath.
ewlineHis eyes were half-closed as he shoved the covers back from his bed, and moved
ewlinetowards the door.  He knew that he had to check on Kate, if he did nothing else. She was
ewlineill, with a heart problem, and he worried about her all the time.
ewline
ewlineThey both lived in a home for orphans, and he had since his parents had died, when he was
ewlinethe age of four. He had taken care of Kate as if she were his sister ever since. He
ewlinewandered to her room sitting himself by her on her bed, shoving her hair from her
ewlineface.
ewline
ewlineShe moved on the bed as he pulled her into his arms, "Kate." He said into her ear, "It's
ewlinetime to wake up." He pressed a kiss to her head, and her eyes opened.
ewline
ewline"Hawthy?" She said, her nickname for him moving from her lips.
ewline
ewline"Yea." He moved her hair.
ewline
ewline"I want to go outside today," she said, and he nodded in response.
ewline
ewline"If you are up to it, I won't stop you", he told her, and she smiled.
ewline
ewline"Thanks Hawthy", she said.
ewline
ewlineIt wasn't long until she fell back to sleep.
student_correct_response: The answer is A: A home for orphans..
student_incorrect_response: The answer is D: A trailer park..

ewlineof friends.

question: Who didn't invite Martha to the party?
story:
One sunny day, Martha went on a walk through the park. While walking, she noticed
ewlinesomething strange. No one was outside. She was the only person at the park. "How strange,
ewlinewhere is everyone?" she thought. Martha looked everywhere. She looked inside the
ewlinerestrooms, under the benches, and even at the top of the slide. She was confused. Usually,
ewlineshe would see her friends playing with each other. She started walking again when one of
ewlineher friends popped up, surprising her. Her friend asked her, "Why are you outside?" Martha
ewlineasked what she meant, and explained that she always came out to the park to play. Her
ewlinefriend then looked at her strangely and asked, "Didn't Stephan invite you to his party?"
ewlineMartha hadn't known that Stephan was holding a party. She was sad that he hadn't invited
ewlineher. She walked back home, upset.

question: How long does James have to play every day for a week to be good at baseball?

ewline
ewlineJames has to practice because baseball season starts in a week.

ewlineHe wants to be a good player when the season starts.

ewlineJames has been lazy in practicing so he is not very good at baseball right now.

ewlineHe has to make up for it by playing baseball for 5 hours every day for a week.

ewlineJames thinks this is enough practice for him to catch up and be a good player when the
ewlineseason starts.
ewline

ewlineand they practice fielding.

ewlineJames, but I think you are going to be pretty good when the season starts!"

ewlineUsually a week is not enough time to get pretty good at baseball but James is practicing
ewlineso much he is fitting a month of practice into one week.

ewlineThen James has a setback.  His glove rips during practice.  He can't keep playing with a
ewlinebroken glove!
ewline
ewlineSo Tommy and James go around town collecting bottles to trade in for five cents for each
ewlinebottle.
ewline
ewlineJames misses a day of practicing but they find enough bottles to turn in for thirty
ewlinedollars.
ewline
ewlineThis is enough money for James to buy a new glove!
ewline
ewlineSo James buys a new glove and he and Tommy go back to the field and practice some

question: Where did the child go when he saw the butterflies?
story:

ewlinewe went to a special place.  We went to the zoo!
ewline
ewlineI saw lots of animals at the zoo.  I saw bears.  I saw tigers.  I saw apes.  I saw
ewlinemonkeys.  I saw snakes.  I loved seeing all these animals.  They made me happy.
ewline
ewlineWe even saw one place where there were giant bugs and they didn't even scare me.  In
ewlinefact, I like bugs.  But there was one place where you walked inside a big room where there
ewlinewere lots of plants and butterflies flying all over the place.  You could buy sugar water
ewlineto feed them and they could land on you.  My mom and brother were so excited to go in, but
ewlineI was scared.  I wasn't sure that I wanted to be in the room with butterflies flying
ewlineeverywhere.  My mom said I would be okay.  My brother said I would be okay.  They said
ewlinebutterflies were nice and beautiful.  They said they would not hurt me.  So I went in the
ewlineroom.
ewline

ewlineThe man watching the door to make sure butterflies did not escape or get hurt yelled at me
ewlineto stop.  He was mad at me for running out and not caring about the butterflies.  I said I
ewlinewas sorry, but I was scared.  He checked me for butterflies and then let me get out of
ewlinethere!

ewlineafraid.  Last year for my birthday, mom bought me a butterfly book.  She bought one for my
ewlinebrother, too.  I tried really hard to not be afraid and to go out into the yard and find
ewlinebutterflies with my brother.  It became really fun to do.  Once, a butterfly landed on me
ewlineand I laughed.  I liked it.  It tickled me.  It did not hurt me.  Now, I like butterflies!

question: Who was Chocolate?
story:
Chocolate was a box turtle.  Lauren found her one day on the side of the road, hiding in
ewlineher old, worn shell, frightened by the cars going by.  Lauren picked Chocolate up to help
ewlineher cross the street, because Lauren knew that turtles are very slow and cars are very
ewlinefast.  After Lauren got Chocolate to the other side of the road, Chocolate peeked her head
ewlineout of her shell and looked at the little girl.  Lauren saw that not only was Chocolate's
ewlineshell worn, one of her eyes was shut.  Lauren thought Chocolate needed more help from her, so
ewlineLauren took the turtle home.  Lauren hid Chocolate in her bathtub, because she was worried
ewlinethat her mother would be mad. Lauren went to look up what turtles like to eat and left
ewlineChocolate alone in the bathtub.  Lauren was still looking up  turtle facts when she heard
ewlineher mother call out, "Lauren, get in here now!"  Lauren knew she was in trouble.  But when
ewlineLauren came into the bathroom, her mother was smiling.  Lauren's mom told her that she had
ewlinea turtle when she was a little girl.  Lauren and her mom took Chocolate to an animal
ewlinedoctor who treated sick turtles.  The doctor gave them special drops to put in Chocolate's
ewlineeyes.  Lauren put the drops in Chocolate's eyes, like the doctor told her and soon the
ewlineturtle's eyes were all better. Chocolate's shell was still old and worn looking, like an
ewlineold shoe, but now her eyes were beautiful, like the golden jewels on Grandma's earrings.
ewlineLauren was glad that she helped Chocolate.
student_correct_response: The answer is D: a turtle.

question: What did Mary like to sew?
story:
Mary was a little girl who loved to sew. She liked to sew dresses, shirts, and skirts but
ewlineMary hated to sew quilts. She didn't like anything about sewing quilts and blankets
ewlinebecause it took too long. One quilt or blanket took a week to make, when a skirt or shirt
ewlinetook one night! Mary's mother didn't understand why Mary didn't like to sew quilts and
ewlineblankets because Mary's mother loved to!
ewline
ewlineMary was a normal little girl even if her friends didn't think so all the time. Mary's
ewlinefriends liked to play games and play outside but all Mary liked was to sew. She woke up
ewlineand she began to sew. She only stopped to eat and use the bathroom. Mary's father was very
ewlineworried about Mary. He said that little girls needed to laugh and play, not sew all the
ewlinetime.

ewlinemore sewing, Mary!" He said. He wanted her to go laugh and play with her friends instead of
ewlinesew but instead of going outside to play she ran into her room and cried. Mary was very
ewlinesad that she couldn't sew any more. Soon her friends came over to see why Mary hadn't come
ewlineover to play like her father said she would. When they saw her crying on her bed they had
ewlineto think of a way to cheer her up. Billy said that maybe they could let her sew at their
ewlinehouses. Abby thought it was a great idea. So then all Mary's friends bought sewing things
ewlinewith their money so that Mary would be happy again. When Mary's father saw Mary go to one
ewlineof her friend's house he was very happy. Soon everyone was happy again.

ewlinehad been invited, why not her?

ewlineparty that her friend was not going to.

ewlinewhy Allison didn't invite her to the party. Did Mary do something to make Allison mad or

question: Who does Freddy love?
story:
Once upon a time, there was a boy named Freddy.   And Freddy loved his mom very much, and
ewlinehis mom loved him very much too.  One day, Freddy went outside to ride his bike.  On the
ewlineway out, his mother told him, "Remember to wear your helmet," and Freddy grabbed his
ewlinehelmet and met his friends outside.  When he was putting on his helmet, his friends told
ewlinehim, "Helmets are for girls!  You're not cool if you wear a helmet!"  Freddy thought about
ewlinewhat his mom told him, but he wanted to be cool like his friends, and he took off his
ewlinehelmet.
ewline
ewlineFreddy and his friends went on a long adventure, and they rode all the way to the top of
ewlinethe largest hill in their neighborhood.  Looking down, Freddy was scared.  He had never
ewlineridden down this hill before.  His friends said, "What are you, scared?"  Freddy did not
ewlinewant to come off as scared.  He hopped on his bicycle, and down he went.  Freddy started
ewlinespeeding up, going very, very fast.  He pressed his brakes, but oh no, his brakes weren't
ewlineworking.  Freddy, speeding down the hill, did not know what to do.  He got to the end of
ewlinethe hill and slammed right into a tree.  He awoke the next day in the hospital.
ewline
ewlineAt the hospital, his mother was there.  Freddy opened his eyes and told his mom the whole
ewlinestory.  He told her how we would never do that again, and how he would always wear his
ewlinehelmet.  His mom gave him a big kiss on the forehead, and Freddy knew his mother was right
ewlinein the beginning.  She didn't have to say it.  In the end, Freddy learned that it's
ewlineimportant to not care what other people think, and those that think you're not cool

question: What is the family planning to have for dinner tomorrow?

ewlinea long time."

ewlineblueberries, she turned around to find that Max was not there.  She became worried and ran
ewlineoff to look for her dog.

ewlineShe looked in all of their favorite spots...next to the stream, in their secret hiding place
ewlinebehind the raspberry bushes, and even inside the old cabin that sat in the woods.  But
ewlinepoor Max was nowhere to be found.  Nonetheless, Mary would not give up.   She kept looking
ewlineand she found him not very far away.  He had seen a squirrel and run to chase it.  When
ewlineMary called Max's name he left the squirrel and happily returned to Mary, wagging his tail
ewlineas he went.

question: Why did Max run off?
story:
Mary loved walking through the woods with her dog, Max.  Max and Mary would go on all
ewlinesorts of adventures together.  They really loved looking for blueberries together and then
ewlinefalling asleep next to each other in the tall grass.  One day, as Mary was picking the
ewlineblueberries, she turned around to find that Max was not there.  She became worried and ran
ewlineoff to look for her dog.

ewlinepoor Max was nowhere to be found.  Nonetheless, Mary would not give up.   She kept looking
